summary: This document is a compilation of press clippings from January 14, 2021, covering various news topics including the Capitol riots, Trump's impeachment, and a brief mention of a podcast adaptation about Ghislaine Maxwell. It appears to be an internal SDNY (Southern District of New York) press monitoring digest.

persons.name: Will Pepe
persons.context: MTA worker accused in the Capitol riot, arrested upstate and due to appear in White Plains Federal Court.

persons.name: Mitch McConnell
persons.context: Republican Senator from Kentucky mentioned in context of Trump's impeachment for inciting insurrection.

persons.name: John Kea°
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the representatives (likely John Katko of New York) in the context of Trump's impeachment.

persons.name: Adam Kinzinger
persons.context: Representative from Illinois mentioned in the context of Trump's impeachment.

persons.name: Fred Upton
persons.context: Representative from Michigan mentioned in the context of Trump's impeachment.

persons.name: Ghisaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in a news item about a true crime podcast about her being adapted for television by Eleventh Hour Films.

persons.name: Makan Delrahim
persons.context: Antitrust Chief at the Department of Justice who is stepping down on January 19, 2021.

persons.name: Jeffrey A. Rosen
persons.context: Acting Attorney General who issued a video statement on the seizure of the U.S. Capitol; noted as absent from a high-profile news conference.

persons.name: Marjorie Taylor Greene
persons.context: Announced she will introduce impeachment articles against President Biden, mentioned in a Newsmax interview.

persons.name: Guo Wengui
persons.context: Billionaire who wins discovery on cyberattack in a malpractice fight with Clark Hill.

persons.name: Andrew Yang
persons.context: Announced run for New York City mayor, reflecting on his 25 years in the city.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Acting US Attorney who made a statement regarding NASA scientist Meyyappan pleading guilty to lying about involvement in an unspecified crime.

persons.name: Meyyappan
persons.context: NASA scientist who pleaded guilty to lying about involvement in an unspecified crime and awaits sentencing.

events.title: Trump Impeached for Inciting Insurrection
events.description: The House of Representatives voted to impeach President Trump for inciting insurrection following the Capitol riots.

events.title: Capitol Riot and Arrests
events.description: Will Pepe, an MTA worker, was arrested in connection with the attack on the U.S. Capitol and is due to appear in White Plains Federal Court.

events.title: Antitrust Chief Stepping Down
events.description: Makan Delrahim, the Antitrust Chief at the Department of Justice, is set to step down.

events.title: NYC Cabbie Robbed at Gunpoint
events.description: A livery cab driver was robbed at gunpoint after picking up a suspect from the Paradise Motor Inn in the Bronx.

keyFacts: The document is a press clippings digest dated January 14, 2021, covering a wide range of news topics from the Capitol riots to Trump's impeachment.
It includes a brief mention of a true crime podcast about Ghislaine Maxwell being adapted for television, indicating ongoing public interest in the Epstein case.
Multiple political figures are mentioned in the context of Trump's impeachment, including Mitch McConnell and several representatives.
The document references legal and law enforcement matters such as the stepping down of the Antitrust Chief and the arrest of an individual involved in the Capitol riots.
It shows the Southern District of New York (SDNY) monitoring press coverage, which may include matters related to ongoing investigations.
